understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is related to a method that determines whether to report unconfirmed repaired data mismatches.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is a pair of methods that get and set a boolean value in the configuration. This boolean value determines whether to report unconfirmed repaired data mismatches. If the value is true, both confirmed and unconfirmed mismatches will be reported, while if the value is false, only confirmed mismatches will be reported.

config_description: If false, only confirmed mismatches will be reported. If true, a separate metric for unconfirmed mismatches will also be recorded. This is to avoid potential signal:noise issues are unconfirmed mismatches are less actionable than confirmed ones.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration 'report_unconfirmed_repaired_data_mismatches' determines whether unconfirmed data mismatches should be reported. If set to true, a separate metric for unconfirmed mismatches will be recorded in addition to confirmed mismatches.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The configuration is triggered whenever the 'reportUnconfirmedRepairedDataMismatches()' method is called in the code. The frequency of triggering depends on how often this method is invoked during the system's operation.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of setting the configuration to true is that additional metrics for unconfirmed data mismatches will be recorded. This can potentially increase the amount of data stored for tracking unconfirmed mismatches, which may have a minor impact on system performance and resource usage.
